contentrichtext.text: {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2012}} {{Infobox person | name = Jeremy Gelbwaks | image = The Partridge Family Jeremy Gelbwaks 1970.jpg | imagesize = 180px | caption = Jeremy Gelbwaks, c. 1970 | birth_name = Jeremy R. Gelbwaks | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1961|5|22}} | birth_place = [[Los Angeles, California]], [[U.S.A.]] | years_active = 1970â€“1971 | occupation = Actor }} '''Jeremy R. Gelbwaks''' (born May 22, 1961; Los Angeles) was a child actor who starred in the television series ''[[The Partridge Family]]'' from 1970 to 1971.<ref name="Spin"/> ==Career== Gelbwaks was the first actor to play the role of Chris Partridge. He left the program (and the business) after the first season, and was replaced by [[Brian Forster]] in the summer of 1971.<ref>{{cite book | title=The Partridge family album | publisher=HarperPerennial | author=Joey Green | year=1994 | pages=35, 74 | isbn=0-06-095075-7}}</ref> He and his family moved to [[Reston, Virginia]], a suburb of Washington, D.C., where they remained for a year and a half before moving again to Connecticut.<ref name="Spin">{{cite news | url=http://books.google.com/books?id=b9_qs_-pof8C&pg=PA68&dq=%22Jeremy+Gelbwaks%22#v=onepage&q=%22Jeremy%20Gelbwaks%22&f=true | title=The Partridge Family Tree | work=[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]] | date=September 1990 | accessdate=August 20, 2011 | author=Lauren Spencer | pages=67, 68}}</ref> Gelbwaks worked in the computer industry from 1982 to 1999, studied business at [[Columbia University]], and is now a management consultant. He has appeared in a couple of ''Partridge Family'' reunions with his television family, including "Chris #2." Gelbwaks became a [[computer analyst]] in 1983 while studying chemistry at [[UC Berkeley]]. He is married, lives in [[New Orleans]], and works as a business and technology planner.<ref name="People">{{cite news | url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20106624,00.html | title=By the Way...Whatever Happened to the Other Partridge Kids? | work=People | date=November 1, 1993 | accessdate=August 20, 2011 | author=Tim Allis}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} *{{IMDb name|id=0312235|name=Jeremy Gelbwaks}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Gelbwaks, Jeremy | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = May 22, 1961 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Los Angeles, U.S. | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gelbwaks, Jeremy}} [[Category:1961 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Actors from Los Angeles, California]] [[Category:American child actors]] [[Category:Columbia University alumni]] [[Category:University of California, Berkeley alumni]] {{US-tv-actor-1960s-stub}}
